comments.content: A. Reconciliations helps ensure data integrity across system interfaces by ensuring that data transfers between systems are consistent and complete. The purpose of reconciliations is to compare data from two different sources and ensure that the information matches. This helps to identify any discrepancies or errors in the data and ensure that the data is accurate and consistent. In the event of a data mismatch, reconciliations can be used to identify the cause of the error and make the necessary corrections to ensure data integrity. By ensuring that data transfers between systems are accurate and complete, reconciliations help to maintain the overall integrity of the organization's information systems.
